storyInfo: Totter returns to his hometown to live out his final days in peace, but a series of unfortunate events destroys that peace forever.

attributes.content: It all started in the company bathroom. That day, I was sobbing uncontrollably on the toilet, overwhelmed by despair over my chaotic life.

Outside the stall, a few colleagues who had just returned from a trip to Sargon were chatting about their vacation. From their conversation, I overheard a name and a profound theory that helped me calm down.
And so I packed my bags and traveled from the steel jungles of Columbia to the dense rainforests of Sargon, braving countless hardships along the way. Eventually, I arrived here and met the sage.
Welcome to the Sanctuary. So, did you meet the sage today?
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: I did. It was truly an honor. Even though it was quite late, he still listened patiently to my questions and shared his wisdom.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: What did he say?
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: Nothing. He just coiled the rope in his hands, without saying a word.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: ...Rope?
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: Yes. He was trying to show me my troubles were like tangled threads: if I just have enough patience, I can untangle them to be weaved into sturdy ropes.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: And those ropes will rest neatly in my palm. They will no longer cause me any headaches.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: That... makes sense. The sage is as wise as ever.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: Of course, you're also very perceptive, to be able to grasp the sage's wisdom so quickly.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: Yes. Before I left, he gave me a long, contemplative look. I think he was praising me, in his own way.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: Yes. I think you're right.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: To be honest, at first I thought this whole 'spiritual journey' thing was all just a rumor.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: No. We follow the sage. He has never led us astray.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: I think I'll sleep soundly tonight.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: Then go sleep. Tomorrow's sermon will start at 8:00 A.M. sharp. I will be there to escort you all to the lecture hall.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: ...Each person walks through their life alone.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Like a solitary boat drifting on a lake...
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: The sage sits cross-legged on a massive rock in the lake beneath the waterfall, calmly sharing insights gained from observing the flowing water with the crowd gathered on the shore.
The crowd listens intently, letting his gentle words seep into their hearts.
Hello, friend. When did you arrive?
attributes.name: Victorian Traveler

attributes.content: Just yesterday. How about you? How long have you been here?
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: Almost a month now. Hard to believe, right? Just a month ago, I was still stuck in the shadow of my last relationship, completely dejected.
attributes.name: Victorian Traveler

attributes.content: But you look positively enlightened... Oh, I get it. It's because of the sage.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: Yes. He led me out of the pain and darkness.
attributes.name: Victorian Traveler

attributes.content: Hearing the chatter from the crowd, the sage pauses for a moment, gazes into the distance, and smiles warmly at everyone.
Shh. The sage is looking my way! I...
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: The sage's gaze is so warm. All my pain and suffering just melt away under it.
attributes.name: Victorian Traveler

attributes.content: As I look into his eyes, so full of compassion, understanding, and detachment, I can finally find harmony with everything around me.
attributes.name: Victorian Traveler

attributes.content: Everything that happens to us is but like flowing water...
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: All will flow away, and all will pass.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Look! He's reaching out towards us. That's his signature move!
attributes.name: Bolívarian Traveler

attributes.content: Shh! He's gonna say it! This is my favorite part!
attributes.name: Victorian Traveler

attributes.content: Say what? What's the sage going to say?
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: Just wait a minute, and you'll find out.
attributes.name: Leithanan Traveler

attributes.content: Ask nothing from life...
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Let the river take me where it will!
attributes.name: All Travelers

attributes.content: Wooooah.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: Totter, you stopped in the middle for a little bit. Why?
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: I heard someone's voice in the crowd, so I stopped to take a look.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Oh? Who was it? Which of them weren't paying attention?
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: I don't know. I wasn't wearing my glasses, so I couldn't see.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Tch... Can we find a new location for the next sermon? There are too many mosquitoes here by the water.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Ahem, there won't be a next one. According to our script, you're about to step out of the spotlight.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: About time...
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Thanks to you, we've made a fortune off of these tourists over the past few months.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: *sigh* If only we hadn't been dead broke these past few years, we wouldn't have bothered a sick person like you.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: It's fine. Being away from my hometown for so long and coming back empty-handed... I have to admit, I do feel a little guilty. So I'm glad I can help.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: After all, it was the villagers who pooled the money for my travel expenses after my father passed. Now it's my turn to repay their kindness.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: I must admit, I feel a bit embarrassed for disturbing the peaceful final chapter of your life.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: I didn't expect saving that tour group would bring so much trouble. No idea what they said when they got back that brought all these people here...
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: At first, I thought someone important had come to the village.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: When I listened to their story, I realized they were looking for you. Back then I just wanted to play along and make a little in the process.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: So, you were already planning to rip them off?
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: I just told them what they wanted to hear. It takes effort and skill to speak to people's emotions. So what if I charge them a little for it?
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: (Narrows eyes)
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Compared to those psychiatrists in the nomadic cities, it's practically pocket change.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: Why did you return the money I gave you, anyway? It was quite a lot. There's really nothing you want to buy?
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: Not a thing. I just want to live out the rest of my days in peace and tranquility.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: As long as you embrace the flowing river, you will find your way to the distant horizon.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: ...Isn't that from tomorrow's script?
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Ha. Seems like you've already memorized your lines.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: My time working together with the sage was indeed short.
After spending half a month in the rainforest, he suddenly announced to everyone that he was leaving to embark on a new journey to somewhere entirely new.
He announced his own death.
Hello, sir. Has there been an emergency?
attributes.name: Victorian Traveler

attributes.content: I'm just as clueless as you are. All I know is the sage told me to gather everyone here.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: What? Why didn't you tell us earlier? I'm still in my pajamas. I can't go see him wearing this.
attributes.name: Victorian Traveler

attributes.content: Worry not, for the sage does not care about such trivial matters.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: Good. Oh look...
attributes.name: Victorian Traveler

attributes.content: A few hornbeasts slowly walk out of the rainforest, stopping by the waterfall. A few seconds later, more animals walk out, settling at the riverbank.
A fin leaps out of the water, but the ripples it creates do not disappear.
Immediately, everyone realizes that the river and the waterfall are frozen in place. In fact, they stopped flowing some time ago.
The sage slowly makes his way out from behind the curtain of water, clad in plain clothing.
Fellow travelers. I am sorry to keep you waiting.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: As soon as he starts speaking, the river starts flowing again.
The sage!!!
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: Hey! Hey! Stop shoving your way to the front!
attributes.name: Victorian Traveler

attributes.content: I have to get closer to him, so he can see how much I support him!
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: Sage, the sun has only just risen. What do you wish to tell us?
attributes.name: Victorian Traveler

attributes.content: Last night, while exploring the jungle, I saw starlight filtering through the gaps in the leaves, falling onto the surface of the lake, and I...
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: *sigh*... Fellow travelers...
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: It was there I saw that my days are nearing their end. I called you all here today, to bid you farewell.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Surely you're joking, dear sage?
attributes.name: Victorian Traveler

attributes.content: Nonsense. The sage never tells jokes!
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: Sage, does this mean you can see your own future?
attributes.name: Bolívarian Traveler

attributes.content: The past and the future are just two segments of the same river. As long as we are in the river, we can decipher the messages from the future that come with those ripples.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: But glimpsing into one's own destiny comes at a price. I can feel this place rejecting me; my journey in this world is nearing its end.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Sage, how can you be so indifferent in the face of death?
attributes.name: Victorian Traveler

attributes.content: I accepted my fate long ago. I have found my inner peace.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Fellow travelers, do not weep for me. For me, death is but the start of a new journey.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Wow. I see the tranquility in your face. It's clear as day...
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: I have long come to terms with everything I've experienced, just as the river embraces everything that flows into it and continues its journey toward the distant horizon.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Sage, before you leave us, can you tell us how to interpret all of this?
attributes.name: Bolívarian Traveler

attributes.content: It is not my place to reveal those hidden secrets.
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: Farewell, fellow travelers...
attributes.name: 'The Sage'

attributes.content: A fowlbeast lands on the sage's shoulder. He closes his eyes and lowers his chin, as if in some kind of trance.
The current surges beneath his feet, creating a whirlpool.
The water splashes violently. In the blink of an eye, the sage disappears into the vortex.
Only a small whirlpool is left, quietly spinning on the surface of the water.
In Columbia, I was a failure. I was dead broke, and my family was on the verge of breaking up. But this trip has given me the courage to face life again.
The sage's calm acceptance of his own fate has convinced me that there will always be a river to carry away the pain I've endured.
Odd... this isn't where we agreed on.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Can't trust the guy to dig a proper escape ditch.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Sage?
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: The river flows.... as the sands of time...
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Enough. I already know what's going on here.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: You won't tell anyone, will you?
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Did you know? I happen to be a Sarkaz mercenary.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Uhh... Relax, If I wanted to tell anyone, I would've done so a long time ago.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: From the very first day I arrived, I sensed something was off—simplistic platitudes like that rarely resonate with anyone.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: But I never saw anyone complain.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Why would we?
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: The scenery is beautiful, the food is excellent, and to be honest, you looked quite striking in your 'Sage' getup.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: Most important of all, the cost of living here is pretty reasonable. For us, it was the perfect place to spend a vacation.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: But every time I spoke, you guys all seemed so invested in what I was saying. Like, true believers.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Meh. I treated it as cosplay, or maybe dinner theater. I saw a similar performance in Lungmen once. Only that time, the guy was dressed up as a gangster.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: I've never been to Lungmen.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: You should go some time. It's nice.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: I don't think I'll get the chance.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Don't worry. No one's going to call you out.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: Everyone comes here for a brief respite, a temporary escape from the troubles of real life. Who cares about the truth?
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: In the end, we will all return to our own rivers.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: Just as the sage says.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Yeah, just as the sage says. Our thoughts and troubles remain in our respective rivers.
attributes.name: Columbian Traveler

attributes.content: Totter, you know... if you want to stay at the office, you can. Rhodes Island has a great hospice program.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Field Operator

attributes.content: Thanks, but I'd rather live out my days back in my hometown.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: But didn't you say you couldn't contact your family?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Field Operator

attributes.content: Yeah, because they're all dead.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Then you want to return home to live alone?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Field Operator

attributes.content: Yup. Great, isn't it?
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Great how?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Field Operator

attributes.content: It's peaceful alone.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Having other people around pitying me would only be a pain.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Here, some dry clothes. Put them on.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: What took you so long?
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: ...It's quite a ways from the waterfall to here. You couldn't find me a shortcut?
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Our other plan was to have you disappear in a flock of fowlbeasts. The problem with that one was you'd end up covered in poop.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: Okay, you made the right choice.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: I just hope that once I'm gone, my 'grand finale' will be enough to keep drawing a steady stream of tourists.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: To be honest, the rainforest is huge. There must be somewhere you can stay and rest. You don't need to leave.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: I promise that future visitors will not disturb your peace. We'll also pay for your food and clothing. If you need anything, just say the word.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: No. I still plan on leaving.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Maybe everyone else sees me as a slick talker, but we grew up together—you know I wouldn't lie to you.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: I know. I'm not stupid.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: ...Then why?
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: The sage is right. I should find my own river, the tranquil river that will embrace me and carry me onward.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Aren't you the sage?
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: No. I was just pretending to be him.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Everything he said, I made it all up, Totter. It's all beastshit.
attributes.name: Sage's Attendant

attributes.content: Doesn't matter. I've always gone with the flow anyway.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: It doesn't matter whether the sage is 'real' or not.
What matters is that we all have our trials and tribulations. The day we accept that is the day we shall find true peace.
I think I'm ready to face my future again.
It's been over six months since Totter returned to his hometown. In another six months, let's find some time to visit him together.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Field Operator

attributes.content: Hey... that's...
Totter?!
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Field Operator

attributes.content: ...Some stuff happened. Change of plans.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Field Operator

attributes.content: Anyway, I'm back now.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: So now you're planning to... uhh... I don't know what to think.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Field Operator

attributes.content: Oh good, now that you're back, I won't need to hunt you down in the rainforest. I've got a letter for you.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Messenger

attributes.content: Huh? ...For me?
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: From where?
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: The snowfields.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Messenger

attributes.content: That's strange...
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Who sent it?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Field Operator

attributes.content: Uhh... probably some old friends.
attributes.name: Totter
